title: Jurgen Klopp offered Liverpool exit and Borussia Dortmund return in 2018
text:

Hans-Joachim Watzke asked Jurgen Klopp to leave Liverpool and return to Borussia Dortmund in 2018.

But the German club's CEO says always knew it was a non-starter.

The 2017-18 campaign was a difficult one at the Westfalenstadion; having seen Thomas Tuchel depart the previous summer amid tension behind the scenes - despite winning the German Cup - BVB turned to Peter Bosz as their new coach, following Ajax’s run to the Europa League final.

But Bosz proved a bust in the North Rhine, and mid-season hire Peter Stoger was only ever a temporary measure, even though he somehow scraped a fourth place finish in the Bundesliga.

(Image: REX/Shutterstock)

Lucien Favre would take charge that summer after an impressive spell at Nice, but before prising him away from the French Riviera, Watzke attempted to persuade Klopp to make a grand return - three years after his exit from the club he twice led to the league title.

In his new book ‘Real Love - A life with Borussia Dortmund’, currently being serialised by Bild, Watzke has revealed that he contacted Klopp in the summer of 2018.

However, he admits he was sending himself on little more than a fool’s errand.

"I knew Jurgen would fulfill his contract until the end,” declares Watzke. "Jürgen has always fulfilled his contracts. That's how he is.

"But if you want to go in new ways, and I wanted a new path at BVB at this point, then I at least had to ask Jurgen to consider.”

(Image: EMPICS Sport)

Indeed, Klopp reveals he was mid-flight when he took the call from Watzke, with whom he had previously worked for seven years during his time as Dortmund coach.

“My phone rang while I was on the plane Aki was on it: 'Jürgen, you have to come back’” reveals Klopp. "I thought he was kidding,

"'Are you stupid, have you been drinking, how did you get the idea, I've got a few more years in Liverpool.'”

(Image: Bongarts/Getty Images)

The Reds boss, whose Kop side would go on to win the Champions League last season, says he did not know how serious Watzke was.

However Watzke admits: "I would not have forgiven myself for not asking him at that moment.”

So will Klopp ever return? His contract at Anfield runs until 2023 and while he is in no hurry to depart, he admits he could go back if BVB ever truly need him.

"As a rescuer in need, if the club really needs my help - why should not I do that?” says Klopp.

"It's very nice that I even have the opportunity. But, I admit, it does not seem so likely.

“There’s always something new to come."
description: The Liverpool boss enjoyed seven years at Borussia Dortmund before he joined Liverpool in 2015
